history.content: Are you all done with your remaining CS prereqs (61C, 70 and EE16A/b)?  The only problem with your strategy is that once you declare for DS, you get no more priority for the CS classes anymore.  So you have to weigh the consequences - declare now for DS, get priority for DS classes (of which there’s only one), or wait until you’re done with CS, then declare at the same time.

Are you all done with your CS prereqs and/or wanting to register for upper div CS classes?  The only problem with your strategy is that once you declare for DS, you get no more priority for CS classes anymore.  So you have to weigh the consequences - declare now for DS, get priority for DS classes (of which there’s only one), or wait until you’re done with CS, then declare at the same time.

children.subject: If you’ve already registered for those CS classes for the fall and not intending on using Phase 2 for those CS classes, then you probably are ok.  You just need to make sure that your CS declaration is done before Phase 1 starts for Spring, in October.

So even if you declare cs double major later then you won't get priority for cs upper divs?

I'm planning on taking 70 over the summer so I can declare then. I've taken all the data prereqs already though.

Also how long does the declaration process take? Could I actually declare in time for priority enrollment?

history.content:
Hi,

I've taken all the prereqs for data science although I'm intended CS. Can I declare data science, then enroll into data100 since I have priority enrollment? I could then just declare a double major later right?

For context I'm like position 350 on the waitlist so idt I'll get in.
history.subject: Can I declare data science right now to get into data100?
